gurmukhi: dyK duKwqru pwrQ mwq kO XO krXo qÍY suq hI niRp hÍYhY ] sXwm kI pRIq GnI qum soN iqh qy qum ko Aiq hI suK dYhY ]
transliteration: Dekh Doukhaatar(u) Paarath Maat Kau Yaoun Kau Yaoun Daryo Tvai Sout Hinrip Hvai-hai|| Syaan Kipreet Ghanioum Son Tih Te Toum Ko At(i) Hisoukh Dai-hai||
translation: Seeing the mother of Arjun in agony, Akrur said, “Krishna has great love for you; your son will become the king and you will be in great comfort;

gurmukhi: qyrI hI Er hÍYhY suB l`Cn quie suq SqRn kau duK dYhY ] rwj sBY auhI hI lih hY hir SqRn ko jmlok pTY hY ]1017]
transliteration: Terihior Hvai-hai Soubh Lachchhan Tue Sout Shatran Kau Doukh Dai-hai Raaj Sabhai Uhilah(i) Hai Har(i) Shatran Ko Jam-lok Padhhai Hai||1017||
translation: “All the good omens will be on your side and your sons will agonise the enemies; they will obtain the kingdom and send the enemies to the abode of Yama.”1017.

gurmukhi: XoN sun kY bqIXwN iqh kI mn mY AkRÍrih mMqR ibcwrXo ] kY kY pRnwm clXo qbhI niRpu qÍY suq hY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Yon Soun Kai Bateeyaan Tih Kiman Mai Akroorah(i) Mantra Bichdaryo|| Kai Kai Prannm Chadyo Tab-hinrip Tvai Sout Hai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo||
translation: Listening to the words of Kunti, Akrur thought of going; he bowed and left; in order to know the affection of people,

gurmukhi: kw sMg logn ko ihq hY ieh icMq krI pur mY pgu DwrXo ] dyiKE ik pRIq ienI sMg hY iqh qy sB Sok ibdw kr fwrXo ]1018]
transliteration: Kaa San Logad Ko Hit Hai Eh Chint Karipur Mai Pag(u) Dhdaryo|| Dekhio Ki Preet Inisan Hai Tih Te Sabh Shok Bidaa Kar Ddaryo||1018||
translation: Whether they were with the Kaurvas or with the Pandavas, Akrur entered the city; when he noticed that all the people loved Pandavas, the anxiety of his mind vanished.1018.
Speech of Akrur addressed to Dhritrashtra:

gurmukhi: pur dyK sBw niRp bIc gXo sMg jw niRp kY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] rwjn moh qy nIq suno khu vwh khXo ien Xw ibD swrXo ]
transliteration: Pur Dekh Sabhaa Nrip Beech Gado San Jaa Nrip Kai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| Raajan Moh Te Neet Souno Kahu Vaah Kahyo In Yaa Bidh Sdaryo||
translation: After seeing the city, Akrur reached again the royal court and said there, “O King! Listen to the words of wisdom from me and whatever I say, consider it as true;

gurmukhi: pRIq qumY suq Awpn soN quih soN quih pMif ky puqRn so ihq twrXo ] jwnq hY DiRqrwStr qYN sB Awpn rwj ko pYf ibgwrXo ]1019]
transliteration: Preet Toumai Sout Aapan Son Tuh(i) Pand(i) Ke Poutran So Hit Tdaryo|| Jjaanat Hai Dhritraashtar Tain Sabh Aapan Raaj Ko Paid Bigadrryo||1019||
translation: “You have the love of your sons only in your mind and you are overlooking the interest of the sons of Pandava; O Dhritrashtra ! do you not know that you are spoiling the practice of your kingdom?”1019.

gurmukhi: jYsy dRujoDn pUq hÍY qÍY ienkI sm puqRn pMfu lK`eIXY ] qw qy kroN ] ibnqI qum so ien qy kCu AMqr rwj n k`eIXY ]
transliteration: Jaise Drujodhan Poot Hvai Tvai Inkisam Poutran Pand(u) Lakhaeeeeyai|| Taa Te Daron Bintitoum So In Te Kachhu Antar Raaj Na Kaeeeeyai||
translation: “Just as Duryodhana is your son, in the same way you consider the sons Pandava; therefore, O king ! I request you not to differentiate them in the matter of kingdom;

gurmukhi: rwK KuSI ienko aunko ijh qy qumro jg mY jsu g`eIXY ] Xw ibD so AkrUr khXo niRp soN ijh qy Aiq hI suK p`eIXY ]1020]
transliteration: Raakh Khoushiinko Ounko Jih Te Toumro Jag Mai Jas(u) Gadeeeyai|| Yaa Bidh So Akroor Kahyo Nrip Son Jih Te At(i) Hisoukh Paeeeeyai||1020||
translation: “Keep both the sides happy, so that the world sing your praises.” Akrur said all these things in such a way to the king, that everybody was pleased.1020.
